entry.title: Fin24.com | Microsoft buys start-up behind Wunderlist
entry.summary:
"The addition of Wunderlist to the Microsoft product portfolio fits squarely with our ambition to reinvent productivity for a mobile-first, cloud-first world," Eran Megiddo, general manager of Microsoft's OneNote, said in a blog post.

Microsoft said the Wunderlist application will remain free in places where it is already available and that there are no price changes planned for Pro or Business versions of the software.

entry.title: Microsoft building 2 cloud data centres in Canada
entry.summary:
Microsoft wouldn't say.

"When a global company of the reputation of Microsoft chooses to make additional investments in Toronto, that's a happy day," Tory said at the announcement.

entry.title: Microsoft building 2 cloud data centres in Canada
entry.summary:
TORONTO - The Microsoft Cloud is coming to Canada.

Microsoft announced Tuesday that it will build two "Cloud" data centres - one in Toronto and one in Quebec City - next year.

The data centres will be the physical home to the technology that powers Microsoft's cloud services for businesses.

Why does Microsoft want to locate the cloud in Canada?

For security reasons, Microsoft wouldn't reveal the actual location.

"They don't have to procure data centre space, procure servers or lease servers or run fibre or worry about power or any of those things," explained Kevin Turner, Microsoft's worldwide chief operating officer.

Microsoft Corp reveals gigantic US$20,000 84-inch Surface Hub
entry.summary:
Orders start July 1 for the Surface Hub, which Microsoft hopes will become a fixture in meeting rooms around the world.

The Surface Hub will "pay for itself and make money" said Mike Angiulo, who runs Microsoft's devices group.

entry.title: Yahoo chooses to stay with Microsoft in updated search deal
entry.summary: The original deal called for Microsoft to pay 88 percent of the search revenue to Yahoo.

entry.title: Nokia Theatre, home of the Emmys, renamed Microsoft Theater
entry.summary: Microsoft and theater owner AEG announced Tuesday, June 9, 2015, that the 7,100-seat venue is being rebranded following Microsoft's acquisition of the Nokia smartphone business last year.

entry.summary: Microsoft Corp. acquired Nokia Corp.'s smartphone business last year.

entry.title: Nokia Theatre, home of the Emmys, renamed Microsoft Theater
entry.summary:
Microsoft and theater owner AEG announced Tuesday that the 7,100-seat venue is being rebranded.

The 40,000-square-foot plaza outside the theater will similarly be known as Microsoft Square, and the nearby 3,100-seat venue Club Nokia will also be rebranded.

But a continuing slump in the PC industry has caused Microsoft's stock to flounder in recent months, marking the end of a honeymoon year in which shares rose steadily after Nadella took the reins in February 2014.

Microsoft's financial results underscore the importance of Nadella's efforts.

But Microsoft still relies heavily on selling traditional software, which contributed the largest part of its $21.7 billion in sales for the quarter.

Then there's a mobile calendar called Sunrise, made by a company Microsoft bought in February.

entry.title: In Tech: Microsoft Tries to Win Mobile Friends
entry.summary:
Microsoft's acquisition of German firm 6Wunderkinder this week for an undisclosed sum is part of its broader effort to win friends in the mobile world.

Microsoft Corp. also bought the startup behind an email app called Accompli, which - like Sunrise and Wunderlist - has won praise from tech reviewers for its clean design and useful features.

Microsoft has since rebranded the Accompli app as "Outlook" for mobile devices.

The expansion is being financed by Google Inc. and other prominent investors, including Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen, who have poured $592 million into Magic Leap so far.

entry.title: Windows 10 available July 29: Microsoft
entry.summary: Touch-friendly Windows 10, which features the return of the Start menu and will run across PCs, tablets and smartphones, is Microsoft's latest attempt to win over mobile users and features a new browser called "Edge."

Microsoft Windows 10, with mobile in mind, arrives in July
entry.summary: Microsoft Corp. says Windows 10 will be available in 190 countries as a free upgrade on July 29 for anyone currently running Windows 8.1 or 7, the two previous versions of the software.

entry.title: Microsoft is reportedly evaluating possible bid for Salesforce.com Inc
entry.summary: Microsoft Corp. is evaluating a bid for Salesforce.com Inc., after the cloud software provider was approached by another would-be buyer, people with knowledge of the matter said.

entry.title: Microsoft reportedly considering bid for Salesforce
entry.summary:
Microsoft isn't in talks with Salesforce, and no deal is imminent, the people said.

Still, Redmond, Washington-based Microsoft has long expected it might compete for Salesforce if it was for sale, one of the people said.

entry.title: Salesforce shares spike on report of Microsoft evaluating bid
entry.summary:
Microsoft is evaluating a bid after Salesforce was approached by another potential buyer, Bloomberg reported, citing people with knowledge of the matter.

Salesforce shares were up 2.7 percent at $73.53 on Tuesday after trading resumed, while Microsoft's shares were down 1 percent at $47.80.

entry.title: Microsoft opens Windows 10 to Apple, Android apps
entry.summary: To win over consumers who use competing software, Microsoft needs to persuade outside developers, who create software for consumers and corporate clients, it's worth their time to create new apps and programs for Windows 10.

entry.title: Microsoft targets $20 billion in annual cloud revenue by 2018
entry.summary: Microsoft said last week that its total commercial cloud revenue, which includes online versions of its Office and Dynamics applications, is running at $6.3 billion per year.

entry.title: Microsoft opens Windows 10 to Apple, Android apps
entry.summary:
Today, after losing ground to smartphones and tablets that run software from rivals Apple and Google, Microsoft wants to make Windows 10 the universal software for PCs, phones and other Internet-connected gadgets.

Although Microsoft has previously shown off some features of Windows 10, it's hoping to enlist an army of software developers as allies in its campaign to build enthusiasm for the new release.

Microsoft's move to help developers adapt their Apple and Android apps for Windows 10 is a major change from the past, when each company maintained rigid differences in their software platforms.

entry.title: Microsoft makes its case for Windows 10
entry.summary: Microsoft hopes to lure more people to use its new Windows 10 software on a variety of computers and gadgets by making it easy to use many of the same apps they're already using on Apple or Android phones.

entry.title: Microsoft Makes Its Case for Windows 10
entry.summary: "Our goal is to make Windows 10 the most attractive development platform ever," Microsoft executive Terry Myerson told an audience of several thousand programmers and app developers.

entry.title: Microsoft embraces Android, iPhone apps in Nadella's riskiest move yet
entry.summary: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella speaks about Windows at the annual Microsoft Build conference in San Francisco, Wednesday, April 29, 2015.

entry.title: Microsoft Corp expects 1 billion users on Windows 10 devices within three years
entry.summary: The company also said it will make it easier to turn websites into Windows applications, as well as older apps that use Microsoft's .Net and Win32.

entry.title: Android apps on Windows phones?
entry.summary: The move would mark a radical shift for Microsoft, which has struggled to attract users and has only 3% of the global smartphone market.

entry.title: Microsoft to allow Android apps on Windows phones -sources
entry.summary: Microsoft is expected to make the announcement at its developer conference in San Francisco later on Wednesday.

entry.title: Microsoft makes its case for Windows 10
entry.summary: That's why the tech giant is making its case Wednesday before an army of software developers who may be crucial allies in its campaign to build enthusiasm among consumers for the next version of Microsoft's flagship operating system, coming later this year.

entry.title: Microsoft makes its case for Windows 10
entry.summary: The company also has a big carrot to wave in front of those developers: Microsoft has already said it will release Windows 10 as a free upgrade to people who now have PCs or other gadgets running the previous two versions of Windows, provided they upgrade in the coming year.

entry.title: Microsoft makes its case for Windows 10
entry.summary:
SAN FRANCISCO (AP) - Microsoft figures one way to get people psyched about Windows 10 is to make sure there are plenty of cool features and apps for smartphones and tablets that use the new operating system.

While Microsoft has already previewed some aspects of the new Windows, a parade of top executives will use Microsoft's annual "Build" conference to demonstrate more software features and app-building tools, with an emphasis on mobile devices as well as PCs.

But perhaps most importantly, this year's conference is an opportunity for Microsoft to persuade an audience of more than 5,000 techies and independent programmers that it's worth their time to create new apps and programs for Windows 10.

He said Microsoft has struggled with a "chicken-and-egg" problem, in which developers have been reluctant to build mobile apps for Windows because relatively few people use Windows phones and tablets.

entry.title: Microsoft makes its case for Windows 10
entry.summary:
Microsoft hopes it has solved that problem by designing Windows 10 so it's easier for developers to build "universal" apps that work on a variety of Windows devices, from phones to PCs and other gadgets, Gownder said.

Microsoft has not said exactly when Windows 10 is coming, and some analysts are hoping the company will announce a release date at the conference, along with details about how it will distribute future upgrades.

entry.title: Microsoft phones infringe patents: U.S. International Trade Commission judge

entry.summary:
The judge, Theodore Essex, said that Microsoft infringed two wireless cellular patents owned by InterDigital, a patent licenser, and said it would not be against the public interest to ban the Microsoft devices from being imported into the United States.

Microsoft acquired Nokia's handset division last year.

Microsoft called Monday's decision one step in the process.

entry.title: Nasdaq hits 15-year high, propelled by Amazon, Microsoft
entry.summary: (Reuters) - The Nasdaq Composite extended its gains in early afternoon trading on Friday, hitting a 15-year intraday high, propelled by strong results from tech behemoths Google, Amazon and Microsoft.

entry.title: Microsoft's $15B hedge against the dollar: Analyst
entry.summary:
What's behind Microsoft's big beat?

To combat the strong dollar, Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT) engaged in about $15 billion in currency hedging in the latest quarter, longtime Microsoft analyst Rick Sherlund said Friday.

Microsoft was trading at $46.11 a share Friday morning, up more than 6 percent from Thursday's close.

In its earnings statement, Microsoft pointed to increasing usage of its enterprise cloud service Azure, cloud-based Office 365, search engine Bing and Xbox Live gaming.

Going forward, the Nomura analyst sees tough comparisons for Microsoft in the next two quarters.

entry.title: Microsoft profit and revenue beats expectations

entry.title: Yahoo, Microsoft add termination clause in search deal: filing
entry.summary: Yahoo Inc and Microsoft Corp added a termination clause to the terms of their search partnership agreement under which either company can end the deal on or after Oct. 1, 2015, according to a regulatory filing by Yahoo on Monday.

entry.title: Yahoo chooses to stay with Microsoft in updated search deal
entry.summary: Yahoo and Microsoft will keep working together on search, but Yahoo is getting more control over the how its search page looks and works.

entry.title: Yahoo chooses to stay with Microsoft in updated search deal
entry.summary: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) - Yahoo and Microsoft will keep working together on Internet search, but Yahoo is getting more control over the how the search results are presented.

entry.title: Yahoo decides to stick with Microsoft in search, new deal gives it more control over pages
entry.summary:
An agreement announced Thursday extends a search partnership that Yahoo Inc. and Microsoft Corp. forged in 2009 while they were being led by different CEOs.

As has been the case since the companies formed their alliance, Microsoft's technology will power most of the search results on Yahoo's sites.

entry.title: Microsoft, Yahoo amend search deal
entry.summary: Earlier, Microsoft controlled how Bing displayed search results on Yahoo websites accessed on PCs.

entry.title: Microsoft, Yahoo amend search deal
entry.summary:
Microsoft Corp and Yahoo Inc amended a 2009 search partnership, giving Yahoo more control over how search results are displayed on desktops and mobile devices.

The 10-year search partnership, crafted by former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer and former Yahoo CEO Carol Bartz, allowed the companies to amend or terminate it after five years.

Originally, the deal also included a revenue-sharing agreement where Microsoft paid Yahoo a percentage of Bing ads revenue delivered from Yahoo searches.

Yahoo and Microsoft shares were down marginally in late-morning trading.

entry.title: Microsoft and Yahoo amend search deal
Microsoft hires back Kurt DelBene for corporate strategy job
entry.summary: After Microsoft, he was put in charge of HealthCare.org, the website used as an insurance portal for President Barack Obama's health care law.

entry.title: Microsoft hires back Kurt DelBene for corporate strategy job; will report to CEO Nadella
entry.summary:
NEW YORK - Microsoft said Monday that it has hired back Kurt DelBene to head its corporate strategy and planning.

DelBene was president of Microsoft's Office unit when he left the company in 2013.

In his new position, DelBene will report to Microsoft Corp. CEO Satya Nadella.

entry.title: He's back: Mark Pincus returns to Zynga as CEO
entry.summary: He's taking back the reins from Don Mattrick, the former head of Microsoft's Xbox division who took over from Pincus two years ago.

entry.title: Court questions Google on patent values in Microsoft case
entry.summary:
The value of Google's patents can affect how it negotiates royalty rates with other tech companies, and firms including Apple Inc and Intel Corp filed court papers supporting Microsoft.

After the 2012 trial before U.S. District Judge James Robart, the judge said the appropriate royalty rate was about $1.8 million, slightly above Microsoft's estimate, but well below Motorola's demand for as much as $4 billion a year.

After Robart set the patent rate, a jury in 2013 awarded Microsoft about $14.5 million in damages for breach of contract in a subsequent trial.

entry.title: Apple, Google, Microsoft audited
Apple, Google, Microsoft cop tax audit
entry.summary:
Microsoft global vice president for tax Bill Sample.

Microsoft's Bill Sample said there had been $2 billion in software product and service revenue booked in Singapore but only $100 million in Australia.

entry.title: Three tech giants audited by ATO
entry.summary: Executives from Apple, Google and Microsoft, under questioning at the hearing in Sydney on Wednesday, confirmed they were being investigated.

entry.title: Microsoft pilot program aimed at adding people with autism to workforce
entry.summary: Microsoft is looking to recruit yet another type of diverse employee: The Redmond, Washington-based technology giant is piloting a program focused on hiring people with autism for full-time positions in the company's headquarters.

entry.title: Microsoft pilot program aimed at adding people with autism to workforce
entry.summary: What's more, Microsoft's move appears to demonstrate the real need that the tech industry has for certain kinds of talent.

entry.title: Microsoft to hire more autistic workers
Microsoft looking to hire autistic employees
entry.summary:
"People with autism bring strengths that we need at Microsoft," Mary Ellen Smith, Microsoft's corporate vice president for worldwide operations, wrote in a blog post.

"Some have amazing ability to retain information, think at a level of detail and depth or excel in math or code. It's a talent pool that we want to continue to bring to Microsoft."

entry.title: Obama presents climate change as hazard to your health
entry.summary:
Obama on Tuesday was to announce a series of steps that private entities like Google and Microsoft are taking to better prepare the nation's health systems for the inevitable effects of a warmer, more erratic climate.

Microsoft's research arm will develop a prototype for drones that can collect large quantities of mosquitoes, then digitally analyze their genes and pathogens.

entry.title: Google, Microsoft battle drives down prices for PCs, tablets
entry.summary:
Google is releasing two $149 laptops in an effort to undercut Microsoft's Windows franchise and drive down already falling personal computer prices.

Google and Microsoft are releasing cheaper laptops and tablets in an effort to reach students, budget-conscious families and overseas markets.

entry.title: Google, Microsoft battle drives down prices for PCs, tablets
entry.summary:
SAN FRANCISCO (AP) - Google is releasing its cheapest Chromebook laptops yet, two versions priced at $149 aimed at undercutting Microsoft's Windows franchise and gaining ground in even more classrooms.

Their arrival coincides with Microsoft's rollout of a lower-priced Surface tablet in an effort to reach students and budget-conscious families.

entry.title: Google, Microsoft battle drives down prices for PCs, tablets
entry.summary:
"We cannot be happier that Microsoft is helping drive down the prices of PCs," said Caesar Sengupta, Google's vice president of product management for Chromebooks.

Besides the $149 laptops, Google also is attacking Microsoft on other fronts.

entry.title: Google, Microsoft Battle Drives Down Prices for PCs, Tablets

Microsoft bills the Surface line as a laptop replacement when used with the cover.

entry.title: Microsoft unveils Surface 3 tablet
Microsoft tells vendors to give contract workers basic benefits
entry.summary:
SEATTLE -- For the first time, Microsoft will mandate a basic level of benefits for the tens of thousands of contract workers employed on the software giant's behalf.

It's also unclear how many people will be affected by the new policy, which applies to Microsoft vendors with 50 or more employees.

Microsoft has had an occasionally testy relationship with its contract workers.

Adding benefits may raise costs for some Microsoft vendors and, in turn, the company itself.

Microsoft will work with its vendors to address that as the policy is deployed in the next year, Smith said.

entry.title: Microsoft tells vendors to give contract workers basic benefits
entry.summary: During the next 12 months, the company will require its U.S. suppliers -- which provide workers who do everything from serving food and driving buses to testing software -- to give 15 days paid leave a year to their employees who work on Microsoft projects.

entry.title: Microsoft tells vendors to give contract workers basic benefits
entry.summary: He emphasized that many Microsoft contractors already have paid time off.

entry.title: Microsoft wants US suppliers to give employees paid time off
entry.summary:
NEW YORK (AP) - Microsoft said Thursday that it will push its U.S. suppliers to give their employees paid time off - but that only applies for the staffers that do work for Microsoft.

Microsoft Corp. said suppliers with 50 or more employees will be asked to provide at least 15 days of paid time off for employees that mainly work with the Redmond, Washington, company.

entry.title: Microsoft wants US suppliers to give employees paid time off
entry.summary: Microsoft said it has about 2,000 U.S. suppliers, who provide services such as maintenance and security.

entry.title: Microsoft wants US suppliers to give employees paid time off
entry.summary: Microsoft said it will give suppliers 12 months to make the changes.

entry.title: Taking aim at tech industry inequality, Microsoft extends paid leave
entry.summary:
The second is a contractor, employed by one of Microsoft's 2,000 suppliers.

Now Microsoft is taking one small step toward narrowing that gap: requiring all its vendors with more than 50 workers to offer those detailed to Microsoft contracts no fewer than 15 days of paid leave.

"The research shows that employees who get this kind of benefits are not just happier personally, but more productive," Microsoft general counsel Brad Smith said in an interview.

And second, the more nebulous social implications: Microsoft's new chief executive, Satya Nadella, has been putting his stamp on many things, not just hololenses.

"I think this step reflects a recognition that we want people who do substantial work for Microsoft to enjoy good benefits, even if they don't work for Microsoft."

But this isn't the first time Microsoft has asked vendors to treat employees better.

Microsoft might be the first large tech company to require its suppliers to offer paid leave, but the movement to improve conditions for contracted service workers has been percolating in Silicon Valley as well.

entry.title: Fin24.com | Microsoft pushes deep into Android territory
entry.summary:
Microsoft said it was expanding a deal with Samsung - which had already agreed on pre-installing Microsoft services on its high-end smartphones - to include some tablets.

The deal will provide Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, OneDrive and Skype on "select Samsung Android tablets", a statement from the Redmond, Washington, group said.

entry.title: Microsoft apps coming to Samsung phones, tablets
Microsoft to pre-install Office, Skype on more Android devices
Taylor Swift, Harvard, Microsoft among those buying up .porn, .adult suffixes as a precaution
entry.summary: NEW YORK - The singer Taylor Swift, Microsoft Corp. and Harvard University are among those buying up .porn and .adult Web suffixes as a pre-emptive move before those domain names become available this summer.

entry.title: Taylor Swift, Microsoft among those buying up .porn suffixes
entry.summary:
According to the site, Microsoft has bought not only Microsoft.porn but Office.porn and Office.adult as well.

Representatives for Taylor Swift, Microsoft and Harvard could not immediately be reached for comment.

entry.title: Taylor Swift, Microsoft among those buying up .porn suffixes
As Explorer loses ground, Microsoft readies new web browser
entry.summary:
After 20 years of competing against rival web browsers, Microsoft is gearing up to launch its own alternative to its once-dominant Internet surfing program.

Microsoft has built a new web browser designed for the modern web and mobile devices to go with its new Windows 10 operating system that's coming later this year.

Explorer will still be available, but Microsoft hinted this week that its new - and as-yet unnamed - browser will get top billing in the future.

Microsoft didn't invent the web browser, but it has invested heavily to promote Explorer since it was first launched in 1995.

Microsoft has sold tens of millions of Xbox 360 consoles since their Nov. 2005 launch.

Microsoft countered that class certification was improper because just 0.4 % of Xbox owners reported disc scratches, and that misuse was the cause.

entry.title: Microsoft tackles China piracy with free Windows 10 upgrade
entry.summary:
Microsoft said in January it would offer free upgrades to Windows 10 for users of Windows 7 or later in an attempt to hold onto users and make up for lost revenue by selling services such as Office over the Internet.

Microsoft is working with Lenovo Group Ltd, the world's biggest PC maker, to help roll out Windows 10 in China to current Windows users, Myerson said.

entry.title: Microsoft to ax Internet Explorer brand
entry.summary: "We're now researching what the new brand, or the new name, for our browser should be in Windows 10," Microsoft's marketing chief Chris Capossela said at the Microsoft Convergence Monday.

Microsoft outlines plan to bridge Xbox and PC video gaming
entry.summary:
SAN FRANCISCO (AP) - Microsoft is attempting to break down the walls surrounding console gaming.

That includes HoloLens, Microsoft's wearable headset that gives wearers the ability to interact with three-dimensional images.

"Our goal with gaming at Microsoft is to allow people to play games wherever they are," Spencer told game makers Wednesday at the Game Developers Conference.

Spencer also teased that Microsoft will release an adapter later this year that will allow PCs to use wireless Xbox One controllers.

Microsoft is investing heavily in training developers on how to create games that work across its platforms this week by sponsoring such GDC sessions as "Developing with Xbox Live for Windows 10" and "Gaming Consumer Experience on Windows 10."

entry.title: Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen says he's found sunken Japan WWII battleship off Philippines
